forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain and patchy fog before 4am, then patchy fog and rain and snow. Cloudy, with a low around 33. Southwest wind around 14 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.shortForecast: Light Snow then Slight Chance Snow Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain and patchy fog before 8am, then snow and patchy fog between 8am and 9am, then a chance of rain and patchy fog between 9am and 10am, then a chance of rain showers and patchy fog between 10am and 11am, then a chance of snow showers and patchy fog between 11am and noon, then a chance of rain showers between noon and 5pm, then a slight chance of snow showers. Mostly cloudy. High near 41, with temperatures falling to around 35 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 10 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 43 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the quiet hours of the night whisper through Boston, rain mingles with the chill, cloaking the city in a veil of patchy fog. The air, heavy with moisture and the promise of more to come, sends reminders of winter's embrace as temperatures hover just above freezing. A brisk southwest wind stirs, wrapping the streets in a cool embrace that hints at the drama unfolding overhead. The ongoing precipitation, relentless and determined, signals today's invitation to stay close to home or seek refuge in cozy corners of cafés and libraries.

As dawn breaks, the forecast teases a day of shifting moods—snow giving way to rain, then back again, layered with a persistent fog that softens the edges of the familiar. Expect a day mostly shrouded in clouds, with temperatures gradually surrendering to the afternoon chill. This is not a day for unguarded journeys. Instead, one might don warm layers; a thick sweater under a rain-resistant coat paired with sturdy boots will serve one well against the elements. A steaming cup of coffee in hand and maybe a good book to mull over as rain dances against the windows could offer solace. Today's adventure lies in the mundane—the joy found in simple pleasures, the world softened by the weather, waiting just outside the door.
